items.title: Harlem Globetrotters bringing gravity-defying 100 Year tour to Gainbridge Fieldhouse
items.summary: The Harlem Globetrotters are coming to Indianapolis as part of their 100 Year Tour, with two games scheduled at Gainbridge Fieldhouse on January 17th, featuring gravity-defying dunks, game-changing tricks, and a free 5th Quarter Autograph session.

items.title: Heather Lloyd’s Colts victory blazer shines after Week 1 win
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts snapped their Week 1 winless drought, dominating the Miami Dolphins 33-8 at Lucas Oil Stadium, with Daniel Jones leading the offense and the defense making a major impact.

items.title: What is real -- and what isn't -- from NFL Week 1: Barnwell on the Lions, Colts, Dolphins and Jets
items.summary: Let's size up the legitimacy of the Lions' offensive woes, two run-game surges, Aaron Rodgers' big day and the Dolphins' ineptitude.

items.title: A Look Around the AFC South: Jaguars win big, Texans and Titans struggle in Week 1
items.summary: The Colts and Jaguars won in Week 1, while the Texans and Titans lost.

items.title: Colts beat Dolphins for first season-opening win since 2013
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Colts honored late owner Jim Irsay the best way they could — with a win. They dominated the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, in the season-opener Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. The win is their first in week 1 since quarterback Andrew Luck led them to victory against the Oakland Raiders in 2013. [...]

items.title: What If He’s Good?
items.summary: With games that count on our doorstep, it is really hard to find optimistic prognostications for our Colts.  I know that I have seen a reference to an NFL.com poll that had zero of their 31 “experts” predict the Colts to win the AFC South.  I heard Michelle Smallmon of the morning Unsportsmanlike broadcast include […]

items.title: Colts’ Monday Morning Awards: Week 1 vs. Dolphins
items.summary: Week 1 is in the books for the Indianapolis Colts, and what a way to come out and make a statement. After not winning on their first game in what seems like forever, the team not only won, but obliterated the Miami Dolphins on all three phases of the game. MVP of the Game: Daniel […]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 422: Streak Busters! Colts Top Dolphins in Season Opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts put together a complete performance in Week 1 to snap their streak of futility in season openers. Standout performances from Daniel Jones, Tyler Warren and multiple defenders highlighted the 33-8 win. In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, we look back at the game and how the team honored late [...]

items.title: Breaking down Daniel Jones’ stellar performance vs Miami
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts finally snapped their Week 1 curse—and they did it in emphatic fashion against the Miami Dolphins. The defense suffocated Tua Tagovailoa and never let Miami find a rhythm, but in my opinion the real story was the surprising stellar play of Daniel Jones. From the opening drive, Jones looked decisive, in sync […]

items.title: Trans-Siberian Orchestra to rock Indianapolis with 2025 winter tour
items.summary: Trans-Siberian Orchestra is returning to Indianapolis for one night only this December, performing a reimagined presentation of "The Ghosts of Christmas Eve" and a second set of hits, with tickets going on sale Friday and a portion of the proceeds benefiting Sheltering Wings and the Indianapolis Zoo.

items.title: Colts rookie tight end Tyler Warren exactly as advertised in pro debut
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — The Indianapolis Colts had been longing for a floor-raising pass catcher at tight end since Jack Doyle’s retirement following the 2022 season. After just missing out on eventual rookie phenom Brock Bowers in the 2024 NFL Draft, the clock reset, and fans continued their clamoring for a worthwhile product. As fate would […]

items.title: Colts-Broncos opening odds: No time to horse around
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are riding high after ending their 11-game opening week skid, knocking off the Miami Dolphins at home. The home stand continues this week against the Denver Broncos. These two teams met last year in which the Broncos effectively ended the postseason hopes of the Colts. This time around, the Colts are looking […]

items.title: Juvenile shot in Martindale-Brightwood, IMPD says
items.summary: A juvenile male was shot in the Martindale-Brightwood neighborhood on the near northeast side of Indianapolis, and was transported to a hospital in stable condition.

items.title: Manning, Dungy and other Colts stars talk honoring Jim Irsay’s legacy
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS (WISH) — “Jim, we love you. We miss you.” Pro Football Hall of Fame quarterback Peyton Manning took the podium at the 50-yard line of Lucas Oil Stadium. His former team – the Indianapolis Colts – were holding on to a 20-point halftime lead, but the momentary excitement faded as Colts legends – like […]

items.title: Colts honor late owner with 'win for Jim' mantra, Ring of Honor induction
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Leading up to Week 1, the message around Horseshoe Headquarters was simple — win for Jim. The Colts did exactly that on Sunday afternoon with a dominant victory over the Miami Dolphins. With the roof and window open at Lucas Oil Stadium, the Colts snapped a 12-year winless streak of season-openers, and everyone felt [...]

items.title: Colts fans excited after first Week 1 win since 2013
items.summary: Colts fans celebrated outside Lucas Oil Stadium as the Colts defeated the Miami Dolphins 33-8 in their first home opener since 2013, with a halftime ceremony honoring the late owner Jim Irsay.

items.title: Colts' defense makes statement in Week 1 win over Dolphins: 'New big dogs in town'
items.summary: The Colts had three sacks and two interceptions in their 33-8 win over the Dolphins on Sunday.

items.title: 'Win For Jim' mantra inspires Colts in Week 1 win: 'We're playing for a bigger purpose'
items.summary: The Colts honored late Owner and CEO Jim Irsay not just by inducting him into their Ring of Honor on Sunday, but by thumping the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, to begin the 2025 season.

items.title: Shane Steichen resurrected Daniel Jones in Colts season opener
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — For the first time since Andrew Luck’s second year in the NFL, the Indianapolis Colts start their season with a 1-0 record after besting the Miami Dolphins 33-8 at Lucas Oil Stadium. It was both an important and monumental day for the organization. Not only has the aforementioned curse finally been lifted, […]

items.title: How Daniel Jones, Shane Steichen and the Colts' offense threw a near-perfect game in Week 1 blowout win over Dolphins
items.summary: The Colts became the first team since 1977 to score on all seven of their possessions in their 33-8 trouncing of the Miami Dolphins on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Tyler Warren's NFL debut shows why he's not a typical rookie
items.summary: Warren had seven receptions for 76 yards in the Colts' victory over the Miami Dolphins on Sunday.

items.title: Colts obliterate Dolphins 33-8 to snap decade-long drought in season opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts obliterated the Miami Dolphins 33-8 in Sunday’s season opener at Lucas Oil Stadium to snap what was the NFL’s longest Week 1 drought. Indianapolis scored on all seven possessions to become the first NFL team in at least 47 years to score on every possession of a game. The stampede sporting blue had […]

items.title: Colts legends return for Jim Irsay’s Ring of Honor induction ceremony
items.summary: The Colts inducted their late owner Jim Irsay to the Ring of Honor on Sunday, with Colts legends in attendance, and the Colts won the game against the Dolphins, 33-8.

items.title: Are you not entertained, Colts fans?
items.summary: The drought is finally over. Not only is the eleven year winless streak finally behind the Indianapolis Colts but they ended it convincingly by beating the brakes off the Miami Dolphins. Who knew that all it would take was Daniel Jones. After all the quarterbacks that have suited up for the season opener during this […]

They dominated the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, in the season-opener Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. The win is their first in week 1 since quarterback Andrew Luck led them to victory against the Oakland Raiders in 2013. [...]

items.title: Colts dominate Dolphins, win first season opener in 11 years
items.summary: Daniel Jones was 22-of-29 for 272 yards and a touchdown, with two rushing touchdowns of his own, in the Colts' 33-8 win.

items.title: Colts dominate Dolphins, snap Week 1 winless streak
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts dominated the Miami Dolphins 33-8 in Week 1, with quarterback Daniel Jones leading the way with 272 passing yards, 26 rushing yards, and two touchdowns.

items.title: Week 1 Colts vs. Dolphins Game Thread
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are at home to take on the Miami Dolphins in week 1 of the 2025 season, kickoff is at 1:00 p.m. EST. There’s a new starting quarterback in Indianapolis (I’m sure you’ve heard about it) and this will be Daniel Jones’ first crack at leading the 2025 Colts. Enough digital ink has been spilled […]

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Jim Irsay Memories
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic goes sideline to sideline with the Colts trying to give fans more insight to their favorite players. With Jim Irsay going into the franchise's Ring of Honor today, Chris asks players what their favorite memory is of the team's late owner.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts vs. Dophins
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts are looking for their first win in week one of the NFL season since Andrew Luck led the team to victory over the Oakland Raiders in 2013. IndyStar Colts insider Joel A. Erickson gives his keys to snapping that skid in today's season opener against the Miami Dolphins.

items.title: Colts announce 7 inactive players for Week 1 game vs. Miami Dolphins
items.summary: Tyler Goodson (elbow) was listed as questionable on Friday's practice report.

items.title: Shane Steichen, Colts to honor Jim Irsay during 2025 season with custom guitar presented before each game
items.summary: Steichen worked with the Purdue University Guitar Lab to build a custom "Win For Jim" guitar, which a select player will carry into the stadium prior to each Colts game this season.

items.title: How to watch the Miami Dolphins at Indianapolis Colts on September 7, 2025

items.title: Driver dies after SUV collides with house in north Indianapolis
items.summary: A man died at a hospital after the SUV he was driving crashed into a house on the north side of Indianapolis early Sunday morning.

items.title: MY GUIDE TO GAMEDAY…know this before you go. Pls.

Indianapolis will be looking to snap that embarrassingly long franchise streak, and perhaps they’ll get some help from up […]

items.title: Laiatu Latu’s impact critical to Colts’ retooled defense
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The makeover has been extensive and expensive. But whether the Indianapolis Colts are able to re-establish their defense as a formidable unit might well hinge more on a high-profile returnee than the slew of additions. That would be Laiatu Latu. General manager Chris Ballard has given first-year coordinator Lou Anarumo: The renovation of the [...]

items.title: 10 Colts Things: Daniel Jones & Colts' offense seeking consistency and explosiveness, Tyler Warren makes strong impression before rookie year, Lou Anarumo's defense comes into focus, Laiatu Latu showing signs of Year 2 jump
items.summary: The Colts' preseason came to a close on Thursday, and Labor Day weekend will be this team's last break until after they return from Berlin in November. Here are the 10 biggest takeaways from everything that happened from the start of training camp to the end of the preseason, starting with several observations on the kind of offense Shane Steichen could run with Daniel Jones.
